page.title: 09New Forest-Reafforestation 2
page.content: {<Cont}The crop to be planted depends on economic and aesthetic considerations. Therefore as well as softwoods which are economically attractive, hardwoods such as{Oak}and {Beech}are also planted. These are thinned over a 20 year cycle and are not ready for felling until they are a minimum of 80 years old. Oak tree saplings are now being planted in {expanded tubes}which are biodegradable as can be seen in{Stubby Copse}and {Woodfidley Inclosures.}These give a greenhouse effect. The sapling reaches the top of the tube in one year. One tube is planted every 20 square metres so this reduces the cost of saplings: {saplings/hectare trees {Hardwoods-} 1300 2-300 {Hardwoods Tubes-}500 ?answer in 2066 {Softwoods-} 2000 3-400 NI04840159
